page.title: 09HOUSING
page.content: Most of the houses in Shanklin and Sandown were built after the 2nd World War.They are either Private Houses, Guest Houses or Hotels.There are also many bungalows which are 5 years old or younger.There aren't many council houses in are area.The buildings are mainly a mixture of brick,pebbledash, concrete blocks and stone. The style of houses varies,they are mostly semi-detached,detached and terraced.In the Old Village the houses are mostly old cottages and stone houses converted into shops.There is also a pub called the Crab Inn which is a stone built cottage with a thatched roof.Most of the cottages have thatched roofs in the Old Village.
